restrictions: As a general rule they don't take pits because they have too many in their area.  Said upon occassion they will take one that is over the top sweet and great with other animals and people.  They will accept pit puppies
preferences: Can take most any dog aside from pits.  Do great with pups and will take hw+, pregnant dogs and nursing mothers. Said they can also take any dog with a terrible story because they get adopted immediately! She also said they will take scared dogs that will come out of their shell after being in a foster home, etc.
alters: No, they run S/N clinic.  She did say they would appreciate it if some of the dogs on each transport were altered though.
transportVan: Yes and willing to meet in IN. 4:38 hr drive from Columbia to Cracker Barrel. 11701 US-31, Edinburgh, IN 46124
notes: Their site shows pets at the shelter as well as two off site locations and foster homes.  Maria said they have three adoption locations and are always looking for dogs.  Currently get transports from OK & AR.  Maria worked at a shelter in Murfreesboro, TN so is familiar with the overpopulation here.  She emailed me back 8/23/17 and said they can only rarely take over the top sweet pits as they have their own pit problem but she said they can take hw+ but have to keep for 60 days to pre-treat before they start shots so they like to get them into fosters and don't always have open homes, pregnant moms and nursing moms and they move puppies very quickly and will take pit pups as well.  She also said that they can take most any dog with a terrible story as those get adopted immediately. They can alter on their end but would appreciate some of them coming already altered. They can meet halfway and Maria said they will do whatever they can to make things easier on us.

preferences: Small dogs & pups, Friendly larger dogs
alters: No, they run a low cost S/N clinic
notes: Super easy to work with. Dogs are adopted within two weeks. Megan lives close to the shelter and will meet at 6a for intake on weekdays. They have two transport vans so might meet. They do a HUGE adoption event at least once per year and drive to several states to transport in dogs for the event.  200+ animals adopted within hours. IL requires vet to call Bureau of Animal Health at 217-782-4944 to obtain free permit to transport animals into IL.

preferences: Will take most any dog. There is a city ordinance against pits so they cannot take those.  They're willing to take seniors but have just requested not to take any medical condition dogs at this time.
alters: No but it is helpful to them as they don’t have a vet on staff
adoptionSpeed: Slower.  Seem to have a more thorough adoption process. Avg 2-3+ weeks
notes: Very easy to work with but have a board they need to run selections by.  They make decisions quickly though. Provide van rental money + an amazing volunteer, Ruth, usually gives money for gas.  They seem to take longer to approve apps, which is fine, but it has taken a while for some of the dogs to get adopted. 3 of the 9 that they took at the end of June are still there and 7 of the 11 that they took in the middle of July are still there.  They take great care of the animals though.

preferences: Will take most any dog, including pits and seniors but requires they be good with other dogs.  Won't take hw+
notes: Super easy to work with and will always try to help a dog in need.  Very flexible.  Aimee is getting a lot of transports from TX and ASPCA now so has less room and less time. Currently helping as vet tech as well and working 80 hr weeks. Has a heart for teaching and helping shelters improve

preferences: Specialize in pit mixes and seniors
alters: No but it is helpful to them as they don’t have a vet on staff and don't have much money
adoptionSpeed: Slow for pits. Said it will take a few months but Sandy is very careful about their placement.
notes: Very easy to work with.  Tend to always run over capacity so they always have a lot of animals.  Older building.  Had a lot of volunteers walking the dogs when I was there on a Saturday morning.  Sandy has a huge heart for pits and works hard to place them in great homes. Takes longer for pits to get adopted so I would prefer to place with Dubuque, when possible. Sandy will take harder to place pits.

restrictions: None but are very selective on pits because they move much slower
preferences: Will take most any dog. Obviously do very well with pups and small dogs
alters: No but it is helpful to them as they don’t have a vet on staff
adoptionSpeed: Very slow for pits.  Said they've had some for a year. Said they move pups and small dogs quickly but it's taken over a month to place 2 of the 6
notes: Very easy to work with. Building is older and doesn't seem particularly tidy. Kennels were clean and dogs looked well cared for. They're fairly active on fb and posting pics of the new dogs. I brought 4 puppies, 1 Boston Terrier and 1 medium sized pit/terrier to them in the middle of July and none have been adopted after 3 weeks...They had told me the pups and Boston would go very quickly. Contacted 8/3/17 and they said they have some approved apps but all are still at shelter.

preferences: Does well with pits, shepherds & great pyr's among others.  Not as well with hounds types as they get a lot in locally
transportVan: Unsure but Christy said she can meet partway
notes: Emailed 7/26/17. No Response. Spoke with receptionist 8/23 and she said she'd have the Shelter Manager, Christy, call me.  Also recommended looking into Partners K-9 to help with transport. Christy called me back 8/23 and said she does take transports as space allows and that they took about 300 last year.  She said winter is the best time for them to take transports and that I can email her or fb her about dogs and she will take as space allows.  She said they do very well with pits that are B&W, White, Blue, etc rather than just plain brown.  She will also take seniors, HW+ and Skin Conditions.  She said basically any dog that is adoptable.  They just got a 2k grant from the Grey Muzzle charity for help with senior dogs. Delivered Maury hw+ Beagle 9/30/17

restrictions: No pit mixes. VERY picky about any 'pit' features
preferences: Will take most any dog aside from pits. Likes a good mix of small dogs and pups because they have a separate wing for them and they get adopted very quickly. Prefers dogs be good with other dogs and have no known "issues
alters: Prefers they be altered but they do have a vet on staff and will especially take unaltered puppies. Only do S/N on certain days so want unaltered dogs to arrive by Thursday of any given week so they can be altered before the weekend
transportVan: Yes but say they can't meet
adoptionSpeed: Very fast. Usually within days-one week. 20 are adopted within 1-2 weeks tops
notes: Chris is VERY picky.  He will turn down dogs all day long if they have even a hint of pit in their features. He requires all paperwork at least a day in advance so he can have all the dogs logged in his system to make check-in easier.  He prefers that dogs be altered prior to transport so they can immediately go on the adoption floor.  His volunteers and staff are very friendly and generous.  One of the volunteers has given me $2,000 towards transport, another has faithfully sent a $100 bill each month and another regularly sends checks for $25. Love how they receive the dogs and how quickly they get adopted!

preferences: Will take most any dog aside from pits. Are great about taking seniors but have to get vet approval on dogs over 8. Generally take a lot of med-large dogs but also like puppies, of course.
alters: No, they run a low cost S/N clinic
deliveryPreferences: Has to be a weekday on a date they designate. They receive a ton of transports
transportVan: Yes and say they can drive up to two hrs to meet. They are two hrs from DE shelter
adoptionSpeed: Quite fast. The majority are adopted within 1-2 weeks
notes: Very easy to work with.  Require signed MOU before accepting dogs.  Run the best social media of any shelter hands down.  TONS of posts daily including adoption photos. They do their own through behavior testing once they receive the dogs and they do an amazing job with photo and video shoots.  They always post a "look who we just got from Maury Co" video and the dogs always look fantastic.  They do regular offsite adoption events as well and seem to have a ton of community involvement and volunteers.

preferences: As of August 2017, only transferring in small dogs (under 20 lbs) and puppies
alters: No, they run a low cost S/N clinic
notes: Lisa found this shelter via ASPCA video. Contacted 8/8/17 and Kristin said they're accepting new shelter partners but that KY is currently keeping them busy so the only out-of-state transports they're currently bringing in are small dogs under 20 lbs and puppies

restrictions: Only take labs and lab mixes
adoptionSpeed: Fast. Majority in less than 2 weeks.
notes: Foster based lab rescue. Took a hw+ Maury dog from me on 8/20/17. Require dog to be altered and UTD on shots and needed $500 for HW treatment.  Had foster there to take dog when I arrived.

shelterName: Maury County & City of Columbia Animal Control
